edu.wright.cs.jfiles.database

Class DatabaseController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wright.cs.jfiles.database.DatabaseController

  • public class DatabaseController
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to perform actions on the database.
    Author:
    Matt Gilene

        Opens a connection to the database.
        Returns:
        JDBC Connection

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown()
        Closes the connection to the database.

      • createTables

        public static void createTables()
        Builds all the tables for our database.

      • dropTables

        public static void dropTables()
        Drops all the tables in the database.

      • createUser

        public static int createUser(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String pass,
                             int role)
        Creates a new user in the database.

        NOTE: This is a Derby Prepared Statement This function is not to be called directly. Rather only called via an SQL call statement.

        Parameters:
        name - the user's name
        pass - the user's password
        role - the user's role

      • createPermission

        public static int createPermission(java.lang.String doc)
        Creates a new permission in the database.

        NOTE: This is a Derby Prepared Statement This function is not to be called directly. Rather only called via an SQL call statement.

        Parameters:
        doc - XML document
        Returns:
        id of the permission created

      • createRole

        public static int createRole(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new role in the database.

        NOTE: This is a Derby Prepared Statement This function is not to be called directly. Rather only called via an SQL call statement.

        Parameters:
        name - name of the role
        Returns:
        the id of the role created.

      • addPermissionToRole

        public static void addPermissionToRole(int roleId,
                                       int permId)
        Adds a permission to the specified role.
        Parameters:
        roleId - ID of role to add permission to
        permId - ID of the permission to add

      • addPermissionToUser

        public static void addPermissionToUser(int userId,
                                       int permId)
        Adds a permission to the specified user.
        Parameters:
        userId - ID of role to add permission to
        permId - ID of the permission to add

      • userHasPermission

        public static DatabaseUtils.PermissionResult userHasPermission(int userId,
                                                               java.lang.String location)
        Checks to see if the user with the given Id has permission to access the location specified and returns what type of permission access they have.
        Parameters:
        userId - User's Id
        location - File location
        Returns:
        Type of access the user has (READ, WRITE, READWRITE) or NONE if the user doesn't have access.

      • updateUser

        public static void updateUser(int id,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String pass,
                              int role)
        Updates all of the data for a given user.
        Parameters:
        id - Id of user to update
        name - New name
        pass - New pass
        role - New role

      • updatePermission

        public static void updatePermission(int id,
                                    java.lang.String doc)
        Updates all of the data for a given permission.
        Parameters:
        id - Id of user to update
        doc - XML doc for permission

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main, testing purposes only. This can be used to setup the database as well.
        Parameters:
        args - jvm args
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if Driver can't be loaded
